data.title: For Mitch and other Gibson Flying V fans
data.meta_description: Tell me about it, I have been watching the price’s for 4 months closely, and I am going to pay more for a used one than I was able to get new,, but that’s...
data.text:
Tell me about it, I have been watching the price’s for 4 months closely, and I am going to pay more for a used one than I was able to get new,, but that’s the way it is.. unless I put mine up for sale, all I would be offered for it is 700-800 $ .

And yes it has to be another Gibson.

I know what I want

I agree with this. Every time I try something other than a Gibson in a V, I end up disappointed in it. The Gibson has the neck and all the specs I just gel with.

You might want to check the used section of Guitar Center. Everything on there used over $500 is 10% off.

I noticed any V on there for $1500 or less sells FAST. I look on there frequently.

Also, don't kid yourself. You'll eventually need an Explorer to go with it LOL.

I agree with this. Every time I try something other than a Gibson in a V, I end up disappointed in it. The Gibson has the neck and all the specs I just gel with.

You might want to check the used section of Guitar Center. Everything on there used over $500 is 10% off.

I noticed any V on there for $1500 or less sells FAST. I look on there frequently.

Also, don't kid yourself. You'll eventually need an Explorer to go with it LOL.

In my life I have had 2 Explorers, the first one was a 76 with gold hardware, I sold it in 1984 for $500.00 . The second one was a 2017, I just couldn’t gell with it , and I sold it for $900.00 .

I want another V first, then I will try another Explorer..

Howdy-Do, @Mitchell Pearrow;

As you may recall, last year I bought a regular natural V, and love the thing:

View attachment 138153

I see that one of these 70's V's is in stock at my local shop, in the Natural color version (usually my preference):

View attachment 138154 View attachment 138155

What do you (and others of you here) think of the tone of these 70's models? Seems like a very good Priest/ Schenker (UFO-era) tone.

Vin, I have a 70's model. I love it and yes as you suspect it's perfect for Priest, Schenker, Scorpions. It actually plays better than my '93 ('67 Reissue) and my '21 Natural, I like the neck over the other two.

Funny thing about logic. Do I buy an authentic '79 or pay a shitload more for a reissue that comes with a piece of paper that sports the name of someone who has mixed reviews?

Gibson Custom Shop Artist Collection Kirk Hammett 1979 Flying V Murphy Lab Aged Ebony | Reverb

One of the Most Important Heavy Metal Guitars of All Time Metallica fans worldwide are familiar with Kirk Hammett’s 1979 Flying V. It was Kirk’s first Gibson and established his passion for Gibson guitars. Its purchase was inspired by famous Flying V™ players Kirk admired and because he was l...

I agree with this. Every time I try something other than a Gibson in a V, I end up disappointed in it. The Gibson has the neck and all the specs I just gel with.

You might want to check the used section of Guitar Center. Everything on there used over $500 is 10% off.

I noticed any V on there for $1500 or less sells FAST. I look on there frequently.

Also, don't kid yourself. You'll eventually need an Explorer to go with it LOL.

I love the look of Explorers, but that horn gets in the way of my left hand when I go high. The cutaway isn’t wide enough.
